Julie Pauline Gaitan Tabares

  • Endereço para acessar este CV: http://lattes.cnpq.br/0436985181727896
  • Última atualização do currículo em 03/03/2019

Bachelor of Chemistry, 2006; Universidad Del Quindío (Colombia), Master's Degree in Chemistry Sciences, 2013 (Honors), Universidad Nacional De Colombia (Colombia) and Doctorate in Chemistry (Inorganic Chemistry) Sciences, 2018, Universidade De São Paulo, Institute of Chemistry (Brazil). Experienced in chemistry with emphasis on inorganic chemistry, working principally on the following topics involving transition metals: bioinorganic (development of metal-pharmaceuticals), homogeneous catalysis, and structural determination of coordination and organometallic compounds. Skilled extensive teaching knowledge in general chemistry, organic and inorganic chemistry. (Texto informado pelo autor)

Título: SÍNTESE E ESTUDOS ESPECTROSCÓPICOS DE ORGANOMETÁLICOS DE RUTÊNIO-ARENO CONTENDO FÁRMACOS ANTI-INFLAMATÓRIOS E DERIVADOS COMO LIGANTES, Ano de obtenção: 2019.
Orientador: Denise de Oliveira Silva.

Outras informações relevantes

 
During my master's degree, I worked on a project titled "New Complexes Derived from Indenyl Ruthenium with Possible Application in Homogeneous Catalysis" (Nuevos Complejos Derivados de Indenil-Rutenio con Posible Aplicación en Catálisis Homogénea). Primarily focused on the hydroformylation of monoterpenes for the application in chemistry.

As a doctoral student, my research project titled "Study of organometallic complexes of arene-ruthenium (II) containing anti-inflammatory drugs as binders and their interactions with biomolecules" (Estudo de Complexos Organometálicos de Areno-Rutênio (II) Contendo Fármacos Anti-Inflamatórios Como Ligantes e Suas Interações com Biomolécula), Doctorate Scholarship - Coordination for the Improvement of Higher Education Personnel (CAPES). Also, during my time as a doctoral student, I participated in the Program of Improvement of Teaching in the discipline of the chemistry of the elements, in the graduation course of Chemistry (2014) and the discipline of general chemistry I and II, in the graduation course of Chemistry (2015). PAE monitoring/internship scholarship.
